segments.text: I see the water just gushing out of the sink, and it’s making me so anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes like nothing is wrong, but the floor is getting ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children are being sneaky, but the water is the real disaster here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and I think the damage is going to be expensive to fix.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool the boy is on looks like it’s about to tip, but the water is the bigger problem.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is going to be ruined if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll even notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading fast, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to step in and stop this before it gets out of hand.
segments.speaker: PAR
